alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 12:47AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Meriwether and northeastern Harris Counties through 115 AM EST... At 1247 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near F.d. Roosevelt State Park, or near Hamilton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Warm Springs, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Raleigh, Durand and Harris City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
